website_summaries.verdict: This is a powerful sound level meter that's easy to use and provides an accurate reading every time.
pros: Measures a range from 30 to 130 decibels
Can store up to 4,700 data points
Sensitive enough to pick up even low sounds
cons: This unit may be too expensive for some users

customer_reviews.title: Instead of using the device, use a smartphone app ...
customer_reviews.text: Instead of using the device, use a smartphone app. I have compared and noticed that an Android App is more precise in decibel measurement then this device.
customer_reviews.author: raza tirmazi

customer_reviews.title: NOT PROFESSIONAL BUT VERY GOOD
customer_reviews.text: is not accurate like the professional phonometer , but for this price is very good, i test just the noises on the ships motor and i comparate with professional db meter ( 800 $ ) and this BAFX have just 2 db of difference up to 115 db... if you need for not professional use is perfect!!!
customer_reviews.author: Stefanotekniko

customer_reviews.title: Easy and fun
customer_reviews.text: We are replacing our air conditioner tomorrow, and plan to use this to see if the manufacturer and vendor's claims are anywhere close to true. This meter has a reassuring tendency to settle on a range of numbers, even as it displays decibels to the tenths place. My ten year old daughter ran around the yard measuring the air conditioner noise. We both found it extremely easy and fun to use. It's so simple. It's one of those rare products with two buttons that just works out of the box. If I returned to the same place in the yard, the readings were the same. It's a solid little unit.
customer_reviews.author: Bayard West

customer_reviews.title: Does not measure subwoofer range...
customer_reviews.text: Only works when measuring full range speakers but not with subs. Giving it 1 star since the documentation says it suppose to measure from 31hz but that is not the case. I have to use my UMIK-1 to properly measure the level of my subs. Dont buy if you need to measure your sub.
customer_reviews.author: Elektrokoy

customer_reviews.title: Great tool.
customer_reviews.text: This meter gives you a usable unit of measure to all forms of sound from ambient noise all the way up through your neighbor’s car with no exhaust. The meter has a mount point for a tripod or camera attach point, which allows you to position the meter and still read it. It has an auto shut off feature too. The display is large and easy to read. This was worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: David Y.

customer_reviews.title: Works well but cannot use many rechargable batteries
customer_reviews.text: I have found the record to PC feature very useful for documenting noise issues. Oddly, many rechargeable batteries do not fit like Amazon Basics or Duracell. If you do an internet search, there are a range of allowed diameters for AA batteries. Poor design not being able to accommodate the full range. Energizer brand of non rechargeable fits fine.
customer_reviews.author: M. Powers

customer_reviews.title: They don't mention you need a calibrator
customer_reviews.text: I purchased an $18 decibel meter. When I received it, the instructions state it needs to be calibrated with an audio calibrator, which start at $150. Obviously I'm not going to spend $150 to calibrate an $18 decibel meter, so the meter is useless.
customer_reviews.author: Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Top notch product and service!
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with this product! Well made and easy to use. Contacted Mark Cowen, the owner of BAFX Products, with a question on how to use it properly in my scenario. Wow! He came back that same day with a detailed explanation of sound monitoring that truly amazed me. It will definitely make this product far more useful to me. Highly recommend both the product and BAFX.
customer_reviews.author: VaVet96

customer_reviews.title: Not Calibrated
customer_reviews.text: Not calibrated out of box. Registered a consistent 45 dBA in a VERY quiet indoor setting with no fans, motors, HVAC, etc. running. Plastic clamshell was stapled in two place, so possibly this one has already been around the block before. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Sarver

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Although I have no way to determine A weighted calibration, it's useful as a display of relative sound levels, especially when used as an indicator to law enforcement. Using a video tape of the instrument as evidence LE can easily see the sound level was decreased as they responded and a loud shout at the instrument can duplicate the sound level recorded.
customer_reviews.author: Kent Peyton

customer_reviews.title: Great product, fantastic support
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this meter to log and average the dB level in a retail store. I had a bit of trouble connecting the meter to my computer, but the Bafx support team was able to trouble shoot and figure out the problem right away. Everything works great and I am extremely happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Michael P.

customer_reviews.title: Product Not Calibrated Properly, Therefore Readings Inaccurate
customer_reviews.text: The first reading in my home office with just me, no A/C, no ceiling fan, almost no noise at all showed a reading of 40-45 dBA. Tried it multiple times...same result. Obviously, it was not well calibrated at the factory. And I am not going to purchase a $150 Sound Calibrator for a $18 meter. So I am returning it for a refund via Amazon's excellent free refund policy. BTW, I have ordered 125 products via Amazon in 2020, and this is the first one i have had to return. In my opinion, do not buy this device unless you already own a Sound Calibrator and are willing to DIY.
customer_reviews.author: Albin Holder

customer_reviews.title: Handy device
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to make sure the noise coming from my pool area wasn’t over the county ordinance. We have neighbors acros a creek in the back who complain about every noise, so instead of obsessing over whether or not we were too loud, I got this. It is very simple to use and the screen is easy to see. I have no way to confirm the accuracy, but the db level it’s showing are just about what I assumed it would be. For a reasonable price, it’s a device that can help people ensure they are within the law and healthy hearing guidelines.
customer_reviews.author: deademafmf

customer_reviews.title: As described
customer_reviews.text: As described, works fine and seems sensitive enough for most applications although I haven't done extensive testing. Very straightforward and easy to read display. Device responds quickly to changes in volume. Nice item.
customer_reviews.author: Romanza

customer_reviews.title: Simple to use
customer_reviews.text: I'm a computer enthusiast and system builder. I'm always looking for ways to keep my systems quiet and and identify potential problems. One day my gaming rig started to make a intermittent odd whining noise. At first I thought it was one of my many case fans going out. This handy little tool helped me narrow down the problem to one of the Rom drives instead though the drive had nothing in it, odd. Anyway, what may have taken me 10-15 minutes to diagnose took only a couple. Out of the packaging ready to go. Well worth the money for me.
customer_reviews.author: ukswrath

customer_reviews.title: perfect for simple use
customer_reviews.text: Solid product. Upon receiving I "tested" it in a variety of different locations to verify it was getting readings in the ballpark of reasonable. By looking up various charts online (db level for quiet room, running washing machine, etc) and comparing them in real life, I found it to be more than accurate enough for my causal, hobbyist usage. As someone who got it for personal use and "fun", it seems perfect. And you can't beat the price.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: NOT USEFUL with or without software on Windows 10
customer_reviews.text: If you have windows 10, the software does not find the device because the device is not recognized by windows. I wasted 57$ on the version with the software. Get something else. DO NOT RECOMMEND!
customer_reviews.author: S. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Not bad at all for the price
customer_reviews.text: Product seems to be decently made and also seems to work as described. Since this is the only sound meter I have ever had, I have to assume it is reasonably accurate. It is simple to use and is very reactive to the slightest noise. The price was excellent and I think it is a good item for the price. I have a noisy neighbor and I wanted the ability to take readings to document the noise level. This seems adequate for the task and, for the price, I am happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Didn't meet my needs.
customer_reviews.text: I got this to try and prove that my neighbors AC units were incredibly loud and keeping me up at night because they refuse to do anything about them even after both me and my landlord have asked them to. Even though I can hear a major difference in volume level when they are off vs on the db meter didn't pick it up. Maybe because it's a low pitch vibration/hum coming from the walls but I don't know.
customer_reviews.author: OmniPhillips

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: It's not 100% accurate but will get you a reading that is close enough. The large digit LCD is easy to read and an automatic back-light ensure you will not miss a reading. Operation is simple. Press the power button and you are ready to go. The meter also displays measurements in either minimum or maximum levels allowing you to gather data without having to constantly look at the display. The meter includes a foam cover for the microphone which reduces interference caused by wind giving a more accurate reading when outside or in breezy environments. The compact size makes the meter easy to carry in a shirt pocket or tool bag.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon5500

customer_reviews.title: In total silence, ambient is about 38db.
customer_reviews.text: Very sensitive to sound. I guess that's a good thing. Seems well built. Shows ambient noise at about a low of 38db.
customer_reviews.author: DirtyFJ

customer_reviews.title: It's pretty basic and seems to do what it is supposed ...
customer_reviews.text: It's pretty basic and seems to do what it is supposed to. The tripod mount is a nice feature. [Update} An added feature that would have been nice is for the instruction manual to include a do-it-yourself way of calibrating the meter without an expensive calibration machine or sendign it off to a service company. The manual does say it should be calibrated every year and that the meter comes calibrated when you get it. I was thinking of something like setting it X number of feet from a leaf blower and recording the temperature and dbA levels.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Accurate , but flimsy
customer_reviews.text: So, here is the problem I have with this product- every time I press the max button, the db does up. Pressing the button makes a very light clicking sound- so instead of let's say being 45 db, it immediately goes to 57 db. I try to avoid this by pressing very lightly and slowly but it is just an inconvenience. I have another meter/ different brand and it does not have that issue. It seems accurate compared to other meters I have.
customer_reviews.author: JustShopping

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional Product
customer_reviews.text: High quality instrument for the nominal price you pay. This particular meter is competitively priced among others I have found online, and in many instances, is better overall than some higher-priced models. The display's integrated light sensor adjusts the backlighting exceptionally well and helps to prolong battery life. Other features, such as the built-in tripod mount and "MAX" button are a nice touch. Some features consumers looking for in upper-end devices that this product lacks include: a graphic representation of sound pressure over time, C frequency-weighting (mostly found exclusively in Class One meters), and the ability to log any collected data.
customer_reviews.author: Joe2496

customer_reviews.title: Works for the purposes I needed it for!
customer_reviews.text: Don't know how accurate it is but it served my duel purpose of recording the db of my neighbors target practice and the extremely loud volume at the movie theater. The town won't deal with the target shooting but the theater responded to an angry email (after a movie was too loud wearing ear-plugs!) when I sent corporate HQ a message saying the next time I'd be contacting my Senator about passing a regulation for the safety of their constituents! Went to the latest Avengers movie with 2 sets of hearing protection and the meter and surprise! The previews (which are always extremely loud) and the movie itself maxed out a 85db. Positively quiet for this theater.
customer_reviews.author: T. Allen

customer_reviews.title: Works great to prove to the cops that the bar down ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great to prove to the cops that the bar down the street is violating federal noise laws. Supposed to be under certain decibels from TWENTY feet from noise source. Well, if these say it's over that from two blocks away, that's enough for the cops.
customer_reviews.author: HaveBoughtTHis

customer_reviews.title: Elevation
customer_reviews.text: Upon receiving the item, I read the user manual which states that it is not efficient if your elevation is over 2000 ft. Luckily for me, I live at 5000 ft above sea level and this item is useless
customer_reviews.author: Smalls

customer_reviews.title: Works as promised, works well, wish it had average
customer_reviews.text: Works as promised, however, I would have liked the ability to aggregate noise data and generate an average. I bought this to test road noise before and after a tire change, i would hold it up in the car and look at it, but this data wasn't taht reliable. What I found more reliable was an app taht was capable of maintaining an average decibel rating.
customer_reviews.author: Rohan Roy

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive but fairly accurate sound meter
customer_reviews.text: Bought this so that I could measure the sound of my generators - compare to the manufacturer claims. After it arrived, I realized I could have saved the $15 or so that I spent and have downloaded a free iPhone app that measure decibels. But, now I have both - and they are consistently within 1-2 decibels of each other at all sound levels and volumes.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Dourov

customer_reviews.title: can you hear me now?
customer_reviews.text: I've always wanted a decibel meter and when this showed up for this price in my "you might like this" from Amazon I figured I'd give it a try. I don't have another decibel meter to compare it's accuracy, but it seems to have a pretty normal ambient reading and it seems precise enough to measure the sound of 3-4 different pellet guns.
customer_reviews.author: Slomo

customer_reviews.title: Awesome device
customer_reviews.text: I use this to keep a reference sound level when I'm testing or setting up speakers and home theater rigs. Also to see how loud things are so I know how loud something can be before it disturbs other people. It's a nice device. I particularly like that it has a MAX setting. There is a screw threading on the back so you can attach it to a tripod. Great product, surprisingly inexpensive.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Patel

customer_reviews.title: The calibration appeared within reasonable norms and the product worked immediately after the easy insertion of the supplied 9 v
customer_reviews.text: Delivered on time with proper packaging. The unit is as advertised, with sufficient directions for general use. The calibration appeared within reasonable norms and the product worked immediately after the easy insertion of the supplied 9 volt battery. No comment can be made about durability as the product is brand new.
customer_reviews.author: Ken L

customer_reviews.title: Nice sound meter and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this is hard to beat. I wanted a sound meter that would do A and C weighting and also measure peak SPL. This thing does it. I'm not sure I'll use the feature but it can be connected to your computer to display a graph of the sound level changes over time. I connected it just to see what it does and I think for the right application, it might be useful. I can't speak to the accuracy, though the readings I was taking were about what I expected for each of the environments I tried it.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Reischel

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: Great little device, even has light that comes on when ambient light levels are low. Uses 9v battery, which is not one of the cheapest to buy, and connecting it is a bit of a fiddle. On/off button sticks out, so it easily gets turned on if knocking around in a bag or such like. Perfect for monitoring noise levels in my RPM indoor cycling classes. Good value for the price, $20.
customer_reviews.author: Panda792

customer_reviews.title: Seems accurate for an inexpensive dBA meter
customer_reviews.text: I compared this to some mobile-phone apps and this meter seemed fairly accurate and reliable. It's dBA-only, but the A-weighted decibels seemed in sync with the apps I used, which were fairly sophisticated. If you want to get a quick decibel reading with no setup, you can't go wrong with this -- it's a good starter tool. Later you might decide that you need to measure C-weighted decibels or record noise levels over time, save them, and generate reports -- if so, you'll be ready to move on to a more expensive meter.
customer_reviews.author: global music collector

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use. Not designed for subwoofers.
customer_reviews.text: Product is extremely easy to use, portable and easy to read. Just power on and begin calibrating. Unfortunately there seems to be a lack of response to subwoofer frequency ranges (<150Hz). The unit doesn't even recognize those frequencies are playing and continues to show SPL levels in the ambient noise range while the windows and walls are vibrating. In quiet rooms this device could pick up an ant's fart. For the price it's still a great piece but if you're serious about your audio calibration across all frequencies you may want to look for another model. I still like it for normal/everyday use.
customer_reviews.author: Misty Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Fun to use and helpful for a wide variety of noisy environments.
customer_reviews.text: I’m no sound expert. I have a minor hearing problem and Bose Hearphones solved that problem (separate review). But now I want to protect my hearing. I have Noise limiting headphones to use for instance when shooting. Now I’m using this device to measure everything that makes any sound and am getting a clear pic of what and when to use hearing amplification or noise attenuation. I couldn’t believe you could buy something like this for less than a few hundred dollars.
customer_reviews.author: Joe L. Hoyle

customer_reviews.title: Works, but it has a flaw
customer_reviews.text: Seems pretty accurate, however, I have no way of figuring out exactly how accurate. My only complaint is that pressing the "MAX" button causes the decibel reading to spike into the 50's usually. This is a problem when the maximum sound level I want to test is below 50 dB. I believe this problem is caused by the microphone somehow picking up the noise or vibrations from the button as its being pressed. Sometimes I can fix this problem by simply pressing the "MAX" button slowly and gently.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Great Deal and Accurate
customer_reviews.text: This is a great deal looking for a sound meter this one is very accurate I compared it to a calibrated signal from a professional system and it was only .4db off at 114 DB with a reading of 113.6db. the software interface is great for printing out diagrams and recording your readings. I like it that you can pick the scale that you want and it doesn't jump around excessively like other sound meters I have seen for sale. The recording function is a Great Plus!!
customer_reviews.author: Nikola Tesla

customer_reviews.title: Near Perfect
customer_reviews.text: This product was properly calibrated, accurate, affordable ($17) and well designed (e.g. the back light automatically comes on when it's dark). I made over a dozen measurements to compare against a database of measurements, and after accounting for distance they were all in perfect agreement, including with the noise floor were I lived. The same can't be said about smart phone apps which can never be calibrated (e.g. calibrating them to +12 dB @ 70 dB still leaves them off by ~10 dB at both 40 and 100 dB, and vice versa).
customer_reviews.author: TheDude

customer_reviews.title: Good device overall
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to see how loud my bedroom could get when Cargo planes flew over some mornings. Easy to use and seems fairly accurate. The only reason I didn’t give it 5 stars is because the darn thing won’t stand up on its own. Very annoying. How and engineering team couldn’t think to make a flat spot on the bottom... perhaps they loved what they created they couldn’t put it down.
customer_reviews.author: JetSet

customer_reviews.title: Functional and economical
customer_reviews.text: Works well, Max/Min and real time reading are nice features. It would get 5 stars if it did not have an auto-shutoff feature after 10 minutes that totally negates one of my primary intents for this machine. I was hoping to leave this on my front porch for 1-2 hours to get the MAX traffic noise during that period. I can't do that with this model, and post this note about the shutoff since I do not recall seeing that in the sales description.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Twain

customer_reviews.title: Easy and intuitive to use
customer_reviews.text: I have only played around with this meter for two days, but so far I think it’s wonderful. I love min-max feature which allows you to easily capture the minimum or maximum noise level when trying to figure out the limits. Other features I have found while using it were auto off to save battery, and a backlit display that works off of a built in light sensor. I purchased this to help me determine what the noise level of my generator is, and found the readings to be very accurate and repeatable. Highly recommended it.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Falls over
customer_reviews.text: It works ok. I got it to compare the before and after sound from new windows. But I'm really confused at how the unit, which has a vertical display screen with the mic on top, is specifically designed to NOT stand up on its end. Why is this? The bottom is just slightly slanted so it can't stand on a window sill, table, counter etc. You need to lay it down or lean it against something. Poor design.
customer_reviews.author: MacUser

customer_reviews.title: Good product from a responsible company
customer_reviews.text: When I received a meter, I read the instructions and thought I needed to calibrate. So I did. However, the readings jumped all over the place. I then contracted the company and there response and reactions were excellent. No questions asked and they calibrated a replacement and sent out within a couple of days. It arrived and all is well. My only suggestion is to have the instructions updated to note no need to calibrate and grammar check them.
customer_reviews.author: Lievre

customer_reviews.title: Great little Meter
customer_reviews.text: If I had only known that a good decibel meter was NOT expensive, I would have bought this one years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Rick M.

customer_reviews.title: Works great for home audio systems
customer_reviews.text: Used this to help fine tune my home surround sound system, worked perfectly to properly balance the speakers. NOTE: If you are going to use the MAX hold function, you must press the MAX button very slowly and gently. Pressing it fast will cause the MAX reading on the meter to jump because the button make a noise when you press it and the meter reads this noise if you press it too fast
customer_reviews.author: kristan mccaskill

customer_reviews.title: Seems to do its job; all-in-all, a decent, useful tool at its price.
customer_reviews.text: Perhaps it deserves a higher rating for "Noise Level" and "Accuracy", but I have no clear understanding of what the first means, nor how to determine whether or not the performance on those parameters varies from average. The meter is responsive, and seems to display values very similar to another meter in the same price range, side-by-side. The only truly undesirable feature is that the display is near-illegible when viewed through polarized lenses. The other meter does not have this problem.
customer_reviews.author: F. Sheffield

customer_reviews.title: A great tool
customer_reviews.text: I use this tool to look at band and guitar volume levels. It is also great for setting pick up heights on my Stratocaster. This is a must have for electric guitarists. My only complaint that it is very sensitive and the meter is all over the place and so I have to guess at an average sound level which can be difficult. I use two microphone covers to reduce sensitivity and thereby increase readability. I would like it much better if it were less sensitive but I am still very glad I bought it. Value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: taylor

customer_reviews.title: A decent decibel meter for the price
customer_reviews.text: A decent decibel meter for the price. I bought it to make sure that the music I listen to is within the 80 decibel range that my audiologist does not advise exceeding for prolonged listening. It was perfectly adequate for this use. I can imagine that it would be equally useful for checking levels of industrial noise. The way the controls are laid out is very easy to use, and the feature that allows it to keep a record of the maximum sound level is really useful. I doubt that the accuracy is up to the standards an audiologist would use, but for the price I found this to be a very good product.
customer_reviews.author: Ishmael A. Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for checking domestic noise levels
customer_reviews.text: barking dogs, freeway noise, loud music, people shouting, chainsaws nearby - sometimes noises are disruptive and it is interesting to measure just how LOUD things are and to discover anything unhealthy to the ears that might already be mentaly annoying. I trust the dB levels I am seeing so far.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Reiser

customer_reviews.title: Information that I needed at a great price!
customer_reviews.text: I am very impressed with the BSFX Decibel Meter. I wanted something to test the sound lever of my pellet rifles and the DSBX has done the job very well. I set the meter on a tripod and checked the decibel level at point-blank, six feet, 20 feet, and fifty feet. The meter was set to record the "Max" volume. The read-out was consistent over a series of shots at each distance. Exactly the results that I needed. The DSBX is easy to use and very well made. Other, more expensive, units offer more bells and whistles but for what I wanted to do the DSBX is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Useful yet fun
customer_reviews.text: Definitely a solid buy if you are a night owl in an apartment complex. Rather than guessing if you have the volume to loud, or maybe keeping it lower then you would like just to be safe, just do a quick decimal reading with this guy and never worry again. While it’s not precise, i haven’t worries about late night volume in a while. After a while you will get an ear for it and you can make a hand out of guessing the current decimal reading ( person with the worst guess, aka biggest absolute delta from guess to actual reading, buys the next round 🍻 )
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Murphy

customer_reviews.title: I needed something to visually help students understand their noise level.
customer_reviews.text: This is my first use of a sound meter and it’s easy to use for the basic need to teach a group of students how loud they can get and how often the level of noise posed a risk to everyone’s hearing. I use it in connection with literature about protecting hearing and charts comparing various noise activities. For my needs this works well. I didn’t answer the rating about noise level because I didn’t know how to answer - the meter makes no noise, and for my purposes the 30 to 120 reading range is sufficient. I’m happy with the product and glad the price was reasonable.
customer_reviews.author: Mom cat

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: I've had mine for over a month and I'm pretty happy with it. I was concerned with how loud my band practices, and wanted to measure exactly how bad. Needless to say, now we all wear ear plugs when we practice. This DB meter works quick and well. It has frozen up on me one time, and the battery had to be taken out in order to reset it. Since then, it's been solid. I do wish it would update more frequently than twice a second, but for what I do, it's really not necessary.
customer_reviews.author: J.C.

customer_reviews.title: Boy is this a handy thing
customer_reviews.text: Don't know how I lived without this for my home theater. Also it came in really handy when the local HVAC company put in a unit without great attention to vibration. This documented how important it was for them to fix it. Their tech said he was going to order one himself and took a photo.
customer_reviews.author: Philip

customer_reviews.title: Calibration is right on.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to get an idea if we needed to do noise monitoring at work. I didn't trust the app that I put on my phone. We ended up obtaining a professional model with a noise generator for calibration. I tested this little thing with it and was surprised to find it within a half of a dB. The only thing I do not like is that the sensor wind guard keeps falling off and I have to retrace my steps to find it.
customer_reviews.author: Andre Pommier

customer_reviews.title: Great little decibel meter
customer_reviews.text: I have an old Radio Shack model, but I honestly don't think I'll use it anymore. The Radio Shack unit can select two weightings (which is nice), but I don't like having to dial-in a range to get readings. By comparison, this BAFX unit simply turns on immediately and is good to go at any range. The lighted display, ease of use, size, and price all add up to a great little meter.
customer_reviews.author: Willie V. HughesTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Good, cheap and useful
customer_reviews.text: This is a convenient little device if you are curious or need to manage the amount of noise you are exposed to. Super useful for figuring out how loud even common household devices are and if prolonged exposure is able to damage your hearing. I recommend everyone getting one since you don't realize that even listening to your television for white noise all day can actually damage your hearing!
customer_reviews.author: Mr.andMrs.MorenoTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Works fine
customer_reviews.text: This is a very simple instrument and generally works fine. The one problem is that it shuts off after about 7 minutes. I was using it to record traffic noise going by my house. I wanted the maximum reading over a period of time so I don't want it to automatically shut off.
customer_reviews.author: nb

customer_reviews.title: Accurate Calibration!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to calibrate my HT speakers and I tell you it's so accurate I am starting to hear the difference in my speaker levels. The phone app I bought was giving me false readings and I was wandering if I was making a mistake when finding out the sound pressure in my room. I didn't hesitate to purchase this as it was reviewed by Audioholics and they weren't wrong about it at all. So glad I have made this purchase, it now makes a lot of sense to use a true calibration system.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph

customer_reviews.title: Good For Loud Music
customer_reviews.text: I play bass in a ska band and recently got a new amp/speaker setup and wanted to see how it compared to my old rig in terms of loudness. I can't speak for how accurate it is, but it worked well enough for my purposes of comparing the two rigs. After this initial use I have also used it for fun for determining how loud the band is practicing and our shows are. My only complaint is that there is a timeout on it. Size:Advanced Sound Meter (w/ Software)

The BAFX Products Advanced Sound Level Meter offers a robust set of features at a fraction of the price of comparably equipped readers & also comes with data analysis / visualization software! (Software ONLY Windows compatible!) The Advanced Sound Level Meter can measure in both dBA & dBC frequencies within +/-1.5dB to provide you with the accurate readings in any environment!

This Sound Meter also includes a MAX Hold Function which will display the highest reading until a higher level is reached. It can also display if the reading is OVER or UNDER a selected range (Ranges: 30-80, 50-100, 60-110, 80-130, 30-130 dBA/dBC) 

Also included is the Soundlab software for Windows Based computers. With this software you can connect the device to your PC and record (or download recorded data) and graph sound readings in real time via USB connection. This sound meter also has internal memory that can record and store 4700 data points which can be imported into the included software for review.
